docs.snippet: The Capitol Police said “all tests are negative” for the material, found in the Dirksen building offices of Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon....

headline.main: False Alarm Over Suspicious Substance at Wyden's Senate Office

docs.abstract: The Capitol Police said “all tests are negative” for the material, found in the Dirksen building offices of Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon.

docs.snippet: Britain's government sought to bolster London's position as a centre for Islamic finance on Tuesday by extending its 'Help to Buy' mortgage scheme to loans that comply with Islamic law....

headline.main: UK Extends Mortgage Aid Scheme to Islamic Finance
headline.print_headline: UK Extends Mortgage Aid Scheme to Islamic Finance

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's government sought to bolster London's position as a centre for Islamic finance on Tuesday by extending its 'Help to Buy' mortgage scheme to loans that comply with Islamic law.

docs.snippet: Google and comScore, two leaders in online advertising, announce a partnership to help web advertisers figure out in real time who is looking at their ads....

headline.main: Did Anyone Look at That Ad?

docs.abstract: Google and comScore, two leaders in online advertising, announce a partnership to help web advertisers figure out in real time who is looking at their ads.

docs.snippet: Every muscle of Sattan Muanglek's body glistened as he was rubbed down by his trainer with liniment, its herbal odor permeating the dank corridors of Bangkok's legendary Lumpinee Boxing Stadium before a historic fight....

headline.main: Bell Tolls for Legendary Thai Boxing Stadium
headline.print_headline: Bell Tolls for Legendary Thai Boxing Stadium

docs.lead_paragraph: Every muscle of Sattan Muanglek's body glistened as he was rubbed down by his trainer with liniment, its herbal odor permeating the dank corridors of Bangkok's legendary Lumpinee Boxing Stadium before a historic fight.

docs.snippet: Florida state legislators introduced identical bills on Monday to legalize medical marijuana treatment in the 2014 legislative session, in a bid to win approval before a constitutional amendment on the issue comes up for a public vote in November....

headline.main: Bills to Legalize Medical Marijuana Introduced in Florida
headline.print_headline: Bills to Legalize Medical Marijuana Introduced in Florida

docs.lead_paragraph: Florida state legislators introduced identical bills on Monday to legalize medical marijuana treatment in the 2014 legislative session, in a bid to win approval before a constitutional amendment on the issue comes up for a public vote in November.

docs.snippet: Officials in Rio de Janeiro announced that a cameraman who was struck in the head by an explosive device during street clashes on Thursday was “clinically brain-dead.”...

headline.main: Journalist Struck by Flare During Rio Protest Is Declared Brain-Dead

docs.abstract: Officials in Rio de Janeiro announced that a cameraman who was struck in the head by an explosive device during street clashes on Thursday was “clinically brain-dead.”

docs.snippet: Republican leaders in the U.S. House of Representatives will seek to make a 13-month extension of the federal debt limit conditional on the repeal of a planned cut in military pension benefits, lawmakers said on Monday....

headline.main: U.S. House Republican Leaders Propose Linking Debt Limit to Military Pensions
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Republican Leaders Propose Linking Debt Limit to Military Pensions

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican leaders in the U.S. House of Representatives will seek to make a 13-month extension of the federal debt limit conditional on the repeal of a planned cut in military pension benefits, lawmakers said on Monday.

docs.snippet: Unrest reaches Belgrade, where citizens of Serbia are protesting in solidarity with Bosnians demonstrating against corruption and unemployment. Nathan Frandino reports....

headline.main: Solidarity protests for Bosnia reach neighboring Serbia
headline.sub: Solidarity protests for Bosnia reach neighboring Serbia

docs.lead_paragraph: Unrest reaches Belgrade, where citizens of Serbia are protesting in solidarity with Bosnians demonstrating against corruption and unemployment. Nathan Frandino reports.

docs.snippet: A second round of Syria peace talks got off to a shaky start on Monday, with the two sides complaining about violations of a local ceasefire. Deborah Lutterbeck reports....

headline.main: Second round of Syria talks makes faltering start
headline.sub: Second round of Syria talks makes faltering start

docs.lead_paragraph: A second round of Syria peace talks got off to a shaky start on Monday, with the two sides complaining about violations of a local ceasefire. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.
